intro: Centaurea affinis subsp. affinis, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces bright blue to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are surrounded by pale yellow bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, rocky areas, and along roadsides.
